hypothesis_content.title: Cross-Exchange Liquidity Migration Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: When Binance's BTC dominance in spot trading volume declines by >15% relative to Coinbase/Kraken combined over 4 hours during NEUTRAL/BEAR regimes, BTC price experiences directional momentum (2-4%) toward the exchange with increasing liquidity share over the next 6-12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Institutional and algorithmic traders migrate liquidity based on perceived platform risk/opportunity. This creates temporary price pressure as large orders execute on specific venues. The effect is strongest during uncertain regimes.
entry_conditions: Binance BTC spot volume / (Coinbase + Kraken BTC spot volume) drops >15% over 4 hours
Price correlation between exchanges remains >0.98 (no arbitrage gaps)
Identify which exchange is gaining share (momentum direction)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3.5% move in momentum direction OR liquidity ratio stabilizes (±5% change over 2 hours)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Liquidity shifts occur without corresponding price momentum (>70% of cases) or momentum direction is random relative to exchange flows.
